source_id: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_015_chunk6
evidence_span: At $5 8 9 ~ \mathrm { \tt K }$ , Zircaloy-4 undergoes accelerated corrosion, from the very beginning, in 0.5 and $1 \textbf { M }$ solutions but not in dilute $1 0 ^ { - 3 }$ and $1 0 ^ { - 1 } \mathbf { M }$ solutions or in molten salts containing a higher concentration of lithium hydroxide than the concentrated aqueous solutions.

source_id: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_015_chunk6
evidence_span: At $5 8 9 ~ \mathrm { \tt K }$ , Zircaloy-4 undergoes accelerated corrosion, from the very beginning, in 0.5 and $1 \textbf { M }$ solutions but not in dilute $1 0 ^ { - 3 }$ and $1 0 ^ { - 1 } \mathbf { M }$ solutions or in molten salts containing a higher concentration of lithium hydroxide than the concentrated aqueous solutions.

source_id: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_015_chunk6
evidence_span: At $5 8 9 ~ \mathrm { \tt K }$ , Zircaloy-4 undergoes accelerated corrosion, from the very beginning, in 0.5 and $1 \textbf { M }$ solutions but not in dilute $1 0 ^ { - 3 }$ and $1 0 ^ { - 1 } \mathbf { M }$ solutions or in molten salts containing a higher concentration of lithium hydroxide than the concentrated aqueous solutions.

source_id: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_015_chunk6
evidence_span: At $5 8 9 ~ \mathrm { \tt K }$ , Zircaloy-4 undergoes accelerated corrosion, from the very beginning, in 0.5 and $1 \textbf { M }$ solutions but not in dilute $1 0 ^ { - 3 }$ and $1 0 ^ { - 1 } \mathbf { M }$ solutions or in molten salts containing a higher concentration of lithium hydroxide than the concentrated aqueous solutions.

source_id: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_015_chunk6
evidence_span: Impedance and polarization measurements indicate a high degree of porosity for the oxides formed in the concentrated solutions.

source_id: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_015_chunk6
evidence_span: X-ray diffraction, atomic absorption, Auger and secondary ion mass spectrometric analyses, indicate the presence of small quantities of lithium in the oxide.

source_id: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_015_chunk6
evidence_span: A major part of the lithium in the corrosion films is soluble and can be leached out in acid.

source_id: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_015_chunk6
evidence_span: Zircaloy with fine $( \sim 0 . 0 5 ~ \mu \mathrm { m } )$ , uniformly distributed intermetallic precipitates reveals nodular corrosion in steam at $4 2 0 \mathrm { { \circ } } \mathrm { { C } }$ or below and excessive uniform corrosion in water at $3 5 0 \mathrm { { } ^ { \circ } C }$ , but the best nodular behavior in steam at $5 0 0 \%$ .

source_id: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_015_chunk6
evidence_span: Zircaloy with fine $( \sim 0 . 0 5 ~ \mu \mathrm { m } )$ , uniformly distributed intermetallic precipitates reveals nodular corrosion in steam at $4 2 0 \mathrm { { \circ } } \mathrm { { C } }$ or below and excessive uniform corrosion in water at $3 5 0 \mathrm { { } ^ { \circ } C }$ , but the best nodular behavior in steam at $5 0 0 \%$ .

evidence_span: The tendency toward nodular corrosion in $\mathbf { 4 0 0 }$ to ${ 5 0 0 ^ { \circ } C }$ steam can be suppressed by additions of oxygen

evidence_span: The tendency toward nodular corrosion in $\mathbf { 4 0 0 }$ to ${ 5 0 0 ^ { \circ } C }$ steam can be suppressed by additions of oxygen

source_id: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_015_chunk7
evidence_span: Materials with very fine intermetallic precipitates, which show little tendency for nodular corrosion and behave well in-pile in oxygenated (mostly BWR) environments

source_id: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_015_chunk7
evidence_span: Materials with very fine intermetallic precipitates [...] exhibit accelerated uniform corrosion in a hydrogenated (PwR) environment with a corrosion rate that depends very little on temperature

source_id: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_015_chunk7
evidence_span: in oxygenated coolant. materials with coarse precipitates indicate severe nodular corrosion, which is almost independent of the temperatures within the range of 290 and 350°C

source_id: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_015_chunk7
evidence_span: For optimized BWR cladding tubes ΣAᵢ ≤ 10⁻¹⁸ h

source_id: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_015_chunk7
evidence_span: best range for PWR cladding appears to be at 2×10⁻¹⁸ h ≤ ΣAᵢ ≤ 5×10⁻¹⁷ h

source_id: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_015_chunk7
evidence_span: Nodular corrosion was found in BWRs together with thin uniform oxide

source_id: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_015_chunk7
evidence_span: under regular PWR conditions only uniform corrosion is observed
